https://www.wsj.com/articles/oedipus-review-brilliantly-reimagining-sophocles-on-broadway-b9416144

The cast of ‘Oedipus.’ Julieta CervantesNew York

A powerful politician’s night of triumph descends precipitously into waking-nightmare territory in the transfixing “Oedipus,” an adaptation of Sophocles’ tragedy from the British writer-director Robert Icke. In this ingeniously reimagined contemporary staging on Broadway (“created by” Mr. Icke “after” Sophocles), the Theban king of the original becomes a hard-driving candidate hoping to lead his country as he gathers with his family on election night to await the returns, while a dark fate gradually encircles him like a snake ready to spring.
